text: Baja always has great food and great service and the owner is always friendly!  Try the potato tacos, its sliced potatoes pan fried with cheese served taco style.  They also have a ton of hot sauce that is always fun to grab a few and try them on different tacos.  My only complaint is their fountain drink machine, granted they did fix the ice machine, but sometimes the drinks are flat.  Just need to tune up the carbonation and it will be great!

The owner and employees are super friendly.

The food is always fresh and made to order. Their homemade salsa is great.

They aim to be known as "Home of the Fish Taco," but their potato taco really gives them a unique and unbelievably delicious edge.

Their biggest weakness is their marketing, because if the rest of Las Vegas really knew how great they were, this restaurant would be packed all day, everyday.

They are very cheap and the beers beat any bar's happy hour out there.

Look... it's a dive shop.  It's small, and you'd miss it if you weren't looking for it.  But the food is awesome.  The food is fresh.  The food alone deserves the 5 stars.  What sweetens the pot here is how cheap everything is.  The food and drinks are as cheap as you'll find and the employees are sweet as well.  The owner, Art, he is a doll.  He is normally always there, or he was there every time I have gone.  This is really a great well kept secret.  It's worth the visit and all the follow up visits after that.

Great happy hour from 4-7 featuring $2 domestics and .99¢ tacos, but nothing on the menu over $6.99 so go whenever.

If you've never tried a potato taco I highly recommend getting a few. Crispy and creamy at the same time some how.

They've got about 50 different hot sauces from Tapatio to Red Rooster and free wifi.
Great tacos! My favorite is the potato. Best hot sauce selection in town too. A must-try local joint with a down-home family feel.

The fish tacos here are the BEST!!!!!! 

Reasonably priced and super yummy food. I am very happy I ordered 3 fish tacos, as they are street sized tacos but not skimpy on the filling, and I did not leave hungry! I love that the fish is grilled and not battered and fried! 

I will be coming here every time I visit Las Vegas!
Excellent service, very friendly. Fish tacos and beef tacos were delicious. Taquitos also yum with fresh quacamole. Can't beat the price either. 3 tacos, 2 taquitos, quac, and a drink $12.98.

Walked in one night and there was nobody there. The two guys working said to stay and that it was really good. The lack of people being there scared me so we left. A few montha later after reading all these good reviews on yelp, decided to give it a shot. It was during happy hour so the tacos were like 50 cents cheaper. Man they were good. My favorite was the need (carne asada). They have a taco that is literally bacon wrapped jalapeno. Sooooo spicy which i like but needed lots of water for. It was delicious. The guy working was really nice. Will definately return.

Fantastic! We were looking for another taco spot but stumbled upon this place and I'm glad we did! Fish tacos are grilled and amazing. Potato taco was different, but oddly enough good! I don't live near unlv. But I would drive all the way here for the tacos again!
Excellent meal! Owner very friendly. A must stop. Authentic Mexican food at great prices

I have to admit, I was slightly hesitant to go here since they totally replaced one of my favorite after-class lunch spots, East Boy, BUT they made really good food and I'm so glad my friend convinced me to give them a chance.

Atmosphere was like what any typically college student would enjoy.  Place was well-kept and clean, yet it still has an urban feel to it.  If you ever get bored, take some time to read their bumper stickers/decorations.  You'll get a kick out of the sarcasm.

The staff was really friendly and took the time to explain how their menu and specials worked when they learned we were mostly first-timers.  Food came out pretty quickly and we got exactly what we asked for. :-)

I loved that they also carried about 100 different bottles of hot sauces.  For those of you who love spicy food, this would probably be like heaven for you.

We weren't there for happy hour, but the deals looked pretty awesome.  Great quality food for cheap, and cheap booze to go along with it!

Would definitely make frequent trips back and try out the rest of their menu!
Incredibly fresh food with some great hospitality and friendliness. Definitely worth a regular visit!
Great Management. Steak Sope was delicious. Try the potato taco, it's good and different. I wish we had tried eating here a long time ago.

Best customer service, the owner gladly explains the menu and makes you feel welcomed! Happy hour is amazing, Potato taco is even better. It is the best taco I've ever had. Do yourself a favor and don't order your food to go because the steam and Styrofoam  will really screw up the flavor and crispness of the taco. Love this place. new favorite!
This place is consistently great. Been coming here for five years. My favorites are the pork, shrimp and fish tacos.

This place has a rustic feel to it and it's amazing. The food was perfect! My daughter absolutely loved her pork burrito. The employees are so nice and helpful. Some signs around are so funny too. They will make you,"Lol." They also have a huge amount of sauces and such to go with your meal. And don't forget to get desert!

This place is not your normal taco place, this place serves street tacos like you'll find in LA and San Diego when you're wandering around.  I'm a fan of this place obviously, and it's super convenient located a quick walk from campus, and the free wifi is a bonus too.

I'm a fan of the chicken tacos, but really, all of the tacos are good, and I was even pleasantly surprised by the potato taco the first time I tried it.  The toppings are traditional, and definitely need to be spiced up for my taste, but lo and behold, there are like 20 different hot sauces to try.  You can ask the owner or cooks for suggestions, they know all the sauces they have.  Also, how can you not love a place that does a great taco Tuesday and have great beer prices?

This place is really good and I love to you here and I will come here every day so that I can eat here in this place is really cheap and I like to hear so I'm going to tell my friends that they should

Decided to try this place with my family after seeing a review in a local newspaper during a recent trip to Vegas.  When we got there we were not sure what to order but the owner and staff were very helpful in helping us decide what to get.

I ordered a Fish Taco and Potato Burrito.  The burrito was huge for the price and tasted very good despite not having any meat inside.  The Fish Taco was grilled and one of the best ones that I've eaten.  They have quite a selection of bottled hot sauces on the counter but I didn't try any of them so I don't know if they are good or not.  I just used the salsa and the food alone was tasty enough for me.

I really enjoyed the food and experience here and would definitely like to try more items on the menu next time I'm in Vegas.

Not to many places in vegas. I would give 5 stars.  The street tacos are best in town.  I love that you can choose 50 different hot sauces.I never ventured past the tacos.  I have brought about 20 different people here.  Most are regulars.

Lights every where 
Reall cool lookimg wood chairs and wood table top. 

The beers are 2$ all the beers fantastic deal.  The tacos were all less than 3 dollars and were sooooo good.

I also got a deep fried chocolate twinkie was fantastic.

The cook was so nice,
Friendly people, tasty food and great prices. What more can you ask for? Tried the potato, fish and beef tacos. All delicious.
Came here with friends after a long day at CES. Everything hit the spot and I was satisfied. Customer service was also great!!

I adore this establishment. The owner and lead chef are 2 of the most welcoming men I have ever met. Food is always on point. Flavors perfect. Never a bad meal! Plus you can beat the prices! UNLV game night specials, taco Tuesdays and a weekly happy hour!!! I'd eat here daily!!!

I love this place! 
On my last visit I got the fish and chips. 
-The "chips" were sliced thin enough to have crunch, but thick enough to have potato flavor. 
-The fish was not dry and evenly breaded. 
-They ran out of tartar sauce but who need's tartar sauce with all the sauces on display? I poured myself some green salsa (tomatillo?) and cilantro red sauce into little cups and dipped and dunked my fish. Yum! My own little twist on a U.K. classic. 
Without a doubt I will keep returning :)

This place was our first stop after an early flight in from Seattle, and wanted something light but filling. Not a surprise that the so call "City that never sleep" most restaurants are closed for breakfast/brunch! We happen to stubble upon this place while searching for any opening. Our experience there was great, the owner was friendly (very talkative) and the quality was amazing compare to their price.

So so so so good. Check out the potato tacos so crunchy and unique. I love them! I will be back a million times. The owner is a complete doll and so friendly and helpful. The food is delicious and happy hour can't be beat!
Would've loved to have come here... Walked the mile and they were closed during their "open" hours on a Friday night. Disappointing.
Delicious and flavorful food at a great price. Loved the hospitality and coziness of it and the salsa was amazing!

Potato Taco!!!! I feel as though I am addicted. It is an amazing taco. 

However, so are all their other tacos. They make it to order and the beans and rice are absolutely delicious. At work we usually have Cafe Rio Fridays, but now, we have to add Baja into the rotation. 

The atmosphere is really laid back and I enjoy reading all the signs they have up. There is always this guy sitting behind the counter when I come, not sure if he is the owner or not, but he is funny. He makes suggestions for me every time I come in. Trying something new each time. The potato taco is something I will get with every order though. It is that good to me. 

Happy hour is from 5-7 I think, $1 tacos and cheap beer, and every Friday is Fish Taco Friday which is $1 for fish tacos ALL day Friday. I do not like fish, but if you do, go for it. 

Lots of choices for hot sauce, drink selection is pretty decent, and their raspberry tea is pretty good. So far I like this place, especially the food I have had so far. I am happy that my co-worker and I have yummy Fridays!

One of those hole in the wall places, or like hole near unlv. it's very nice environment i ll give it that. Funny stickers and Art and weirdness ora going on in this place. food is tasty, affordable, and not so common. cool spot to just kick it, meet friends, and grab a bite. I know they have some kind of happy hour but i m not really much of a drinker so i m quite unsure how good of the deals are, but i m sure you wont be disappointed
This is my favorite place to go for taco tuesdays.  The owners are always so nice and they always have a variety of sauces.

Great place to eat if you are tired of the expensive joints on the strip. The Potato Taco is outstanding.  Since the food seems to be cooked to order, and service is a bit slow, make sure you order all of the food for the happy hour special up front because you may not get a chance to get in a second or third order.  The owner was friendly.  The food was good. They even had food for my vegetarian.  Win all around

Solid burrito spot at very reasonable prices, especially at happy hour ($1 tacos and $2 beers...felt like being back in college). The potato tacos are indeed quite interesting, so be sure to try at least one. Service was above average. Overall, nothing blew me away but I absolutely left full and happy and with hardly a dent in my wallet.

My boyfriend and I were driving to Del Taco and we were met with extreme traffic backup (a fire truck blocking all lanes) we decided to stop into Baja just by chance because we couldn't get to Del taco. We definitely do not regret stopping in here! Everything was so amazing. We have been back a couple times since! Love it.

Low key, low price, great little tacos. Half bar, half taco joint. Bar side has good beer on the cheap ($2 bottles on thurs) and you can eat your great little tacos while enjoying Mexico's finest exported beer.  Taco joint side is almost beach taco style. Good place

Pretty cool little joint next to UNLV. Good place to grab some food between classes. They have a lot of great deals throughout the week and fun little atmosphere. I've had the tacos and a surf and turf burrito. Of those options I would suggest the tacos, it's definitely their specialty.
Food took way to long. Small portions. Burnt rice. Went for lunch and they were completely out of chicken and then completely out of guacamole. Everything was meh. Very slow service.
Great tacos. Love the price. Only thing I'd say is that it took awhile to get my food with me being the only customer in there. other than that, they rock.
Good food and service.  You can't beat the price.  Reminds me of Paquito Mas in L.A.
Stumbled upon this place when i was driving down maryland pkwy. Tacos are good, sopes are legit and the fired oreos are to die for. believe me! #foodiehuxstable out!!

Potato and veggie tacos are so awsome! I usually order those even though I'm not a vegetarian. The happy hour deals are super sweet. 

Both manager and owner are very friendly and remember you after the first visit! It is so rare in Vegas that people are so genuinely friendly and enjoy talking with customers. 

You can have beers in the restaurant, but the bar side is very laid back and nice, too.

Found this place after picking up friends from the airport as we all headed to Burning Man. What a gem! Super local - great tacos & margaritas. Perfect as a last meal before heading into the desert. Happy to head across town for a break from the noise of the strip.

I really liked it and it's become a new place on my list of places to go around campus.

The owner and staff is friendly and helpful.
The food, price and specials are good.
Nice, personal vibe, I love the atmosphere, great hole in the wall place that makes you feel like you're not in Vegas anymore (or in a cookie cutter corporate chain- yay for variety).

Tried the steak, fish and potato tacos, all good. Rice and beans are quite good too (for just being rice and beans).

Yum :)

Saw the great reviews and always down to try a taco. As the sign inside says "sex it's a lot like tacos when it's good it's really good and when it's bad it still good". 

Asked the gentleman working here (guessing he's the owner?) if their guacamole has tomatoes. He said yes but quickly offered to make a fresh guacamole for me without tomatoes. And low and behold after my comment if that's okay no worries he is in the back making me a tomato less batch of guac. 

You just don't get that most places.  Oh and their potato tacos are AMAZING.

After coming home from California I thought I would never find tacos that would match the ones from a taco truck. I've been on a journey going place to place to satisfy my taco cravings. I went to places like Robertos, Amigos, and even Mexican cuisine restaurants. I was on the verge of giving up until I came across this cozy little beach-feel taco shop. The owners are super friendly and have to say THE BEST tacos in Vegas hands down. The tacos aren't the traditional Mexican tacos, more like island-inspired tacos. Fish tacos are to die for, but you also have to try the potato tacos. Sounds awkward but it's delicious. My favorite thing about the restaurant? They have over 30-40 different hot sauces ranging from mild to the adventurous super hot. 

Located pratically on the UNLV campus for convenience and the prices? it's cheap! 3 tacos and a drink is like 4.99$
If you're driving by this place make sure you stop by and try it!

Ive gone to UNLV for 4 years and have never been here. Very cheap, almost too cheap to think its good, but it is. Got the 3 taco special of potatoes, fish, and chicken. Fish was not that good, but the chicken and potato tacos were delicious. My friend had the super nachos which were really good. They have HH and taco tuesdays if youre a poor college student like myself. I think hes the owner, but cashier was super friendly. I would like to give 4 stars but they forgot my fried oreos and I was in a hurry to get back to class

Decent taco joint by UNLV- I'd heard good things and finally made it by. You enter by the food counter, then there's a separate bar area. As a whole, this place was a little more run down than I'd expected. Sat in the dark bar area because it was a hot day and apparently that's the side where the AC was working.

Got a trio of tacos for my lunch, they were smaller than expected, like street tacos. Their fish tacos are their claim to fame, but I found the fish itself a bit dry and plain. The shrimp taco was a little sad with like one and a half shrimp for $2.75, but tasted fresh. I got one of their potato tacos as well, and pleasantly found that I liked their version much more than another spot in town where they are featured. I liked their salsa and their tortillas held up well.

I'll keep this spot in mind when in the area. Note that they have discounted tacos available on Tuesdays and Fridays, along with HH drink specials. This spot seems to be more of a bar where you can grab tacos rather than a taco restaurant, IMO.

TIP: Check in on Yelp for a free potato taco or fried Oreo!

I came here for a quick lunch wanting to try something different (ie not a chain restaurant). Based on the Yelp reviews, this seemed to be a perfect choice. It is located in a small strip mall just north of the Bank of America.  Walking in, it is very small (only 7 tables in the main eating area) and very dark. You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table. The manager told me they are known for their fish tacos, so I tried one of those. I also ordered a chicken taco. (Each cost $1.79) Plus when you check in on Yelp, you get a free potato taco ($1.49 value). Each of these is a soft shell taco. I got them with all the fixins (shredded lettuce, cheese, chopped tomatoes, onions, cilantro, etc). The fish taco lived up to reputation - delish!! The potato taco was also excellent. It was like a cut up latke on a soft shell taco with lots of chopped veggies on top. Not dietetic but delicious. The only weak taco was the chicken taco. It was tasty but it was a bit short on the chicken. I had to add the salsa that came with it to give it flavor.  Lunch for under $5 - great value!! And free Wi-Fi. Overall, this was an excellent choice for a lunch.

Baja is definitely a great taco joint! Being next to UNLV campus, it's a great college spot. Even the inside gives off that college-town feel. When you walk in it's the regular, small restaurant area and to the left is an attached bar for the 21 and older kids! I absolutely love how they put the place together, photos of their customers all over the wall and funny signs scattered everywhere too. 

Onto the food, 
No other place can beat the specials here at Baja! They even have happy hour everyday 5-7pm!!! 

The tacos are great as well. I say they're some of the best in town esp for the price. All people know about is Taco y Taco and Tacos El Gordo, but I honestly think Baja falls in the same category!

Ive been feeling seafood recently and once again, Yelp to the Rescue! I've gone to Aloha Kitchen (same complex) a few times but never noticed this place. I walk-in and was immediately greeted by a very friendly and enthusiastic man.. I was looking through their menu for a while.. He told me their ingredients are fresh the fish is a big seller and the potato taco.. Then he told me about their special: 3 Tacos and a Drink for $4.99 (excluding the shrimp). Heck, that sounds good to me and throw in a 4th taco, make it the shrimp.

*All the tacos were served in 2 mini corn tortillas, a slice of lime and they're own hot sauce/salsa

Beef Taco: tiny diced pieces of steak, with the typical pico del gallo topping and some queso. barely any meat and barely any flavor.. Just a Filler.

Fish Taco: tiny diced pieces of grilled Tilapia, topped with queso, pico de gallo but instead of lettuce, they used cabbage. Wasn't soaring with flavor but just right. The cabbage gave it a nice little snap to every bite.

Potato Taco: stuffed with chunks of potato and also had the pico de gallo topping, queso plus some white and yellow shredded cheese. The potato was ridiculously tasty! The cheese was shredded cheese was went with the potatoes like bread and butter! 

Shrimp Taco: small pieces of shrimp that were soft not chewy,  pico de gallo and the crumbled queso went well with it. It was ok.

*Fascinating amount of Hot Sauces to choose from! Im talkin' about  pushin'  about a 100 Different types! I wanted to taste my food, maybe next time I'll be daring and try some of them fire sauces! Cool Staff and Service, Good Prices and Food. Place was Bahafied!!

As usual, we didn't know where we should get dinner so we pulled out our phones to entrust with our friend, Yelp. 

Boy, am i glad we did!  We were heading home from another store and decided that on the way home was a necessity. We scrolled through and decided on this location. 

When we entered it was just barely before 7pm, when happy hour ended. We were recognized as new patrons right away and provided information about the menu and happy hour deals. We were also assured our order would reflect happy hour, even if it took us a bit to decide. 

The boy ordered a burrito, I believe chicken, and a fish tacos. I ordered the 3 tacos plate, all chicken. 

The food was delicious and the service was great. It was a really relaxed atmosphere, small and cozy. If we had the time i could have hung out there for hours. 

Overall, the place was laid back, clean and friendly. Definitely the kind of place we LOVE to frequent. This will definitely be staying on the list!

I love this place! You cant beat the prices and the food is sooooo delicious. They have a lot of options and can accommodate anyone - meat lovers, vegetarians and I even heard vegans. They have a fun drink and hot sauce selection. Awesome place between classes or on a lunch break.... quick, reliable and super friendly! Make sure to enjoy the daily drink or food specials.

I love fish tacos. When I don't feel like driving out to henderson. I will stop here. I love the mango soda with 1 fish taco,1 shrimp taco, and 1 chicken taco. The fish is the best and I will stick with that and just order chips and dip. The prices are reasonable/cheap and it is located right beside the college. Yes, they have my favorite hot sauce Texas pete:)

I actually come to this place maybe once a week!  It's one of my favorite local hangouts. 

The food is really good and the interior has a comforting factor.  The employees that work there are friendly and give the restaurant some character.  It makes this great local joint to grab a quick bite to eat!

Whenever I eat there I generally get a chicken burrito or fish tacos (and potato tacos).  The fish tacos are extremely delicious! I would highly recommend this place for anyone who has not been there!

Friendly, quick, and delicious.  Yum, yum, burritos and fish tacos!! 

I highly recommend for convenient, delicious food.  A MUST TRY!!!

Wasn't expecting too much for a joint near campus and I didn't get disappointed. I was looking for something quick, tasty, and cheap so I decided to try baja out. 

The interior is cool, plenty of table space and seats so not too shabby if you're having a working lunch or supper. The dude at the front was nice and polite. He explained the menu more or less; although, I could have inferred that their main items were tacos and burritos on my own.

I did not like the fact that he charged more for hard-shell tacos, I don't think they're really unique and the incremental cost of producing them over soft-shell is marginal. Furthermore, the hard-shells were opened too far wide so it was difficult to bite into them. The beef was excellent though, juicy, marinated, and tender. The taco was also far too small, about the size of the palm of my hand. The rice and beans were delicious, very flavorful.

The taste was good, but the pricing and quantity weren't completely there.
Wow! The fish tacos were awesome! The salsa is soooo good. And the friendly service just made it that much better.  I will be visiting Baja every time I come to Vegas from now on!
A great lunch stop. The food was very good. Try the carne its very good. The staff was very friendly I will be back in very soon.

the guys that run this place are really sweet, and their food is very good.  not your typical mexican slop.  it may take a minute for them to make it (mostly because they are usually busy), but it is worth it and they have free wifi and it is a fun atmosphere to relax in.  fresh food and good times
Horrible...drove to this side of town only for them to be closed. How about you update your hours on Yelp.

It wasn't what I was hoping for.  It was Tuesday so naturally I wanted tacos and chips with guacamole. Pretty disappointed with them. When I walked in there was a guy sitting on the bench watching TV and reading a newspaper. Two guys were out front chatting about whatever. Not a single person was in there during the 25 minutes were in the place. After a few minutes of looking at a menu at the counter the bench guy got up and asked if we found them on yelp.  We said yes. Took our order. Then the outside guy came in to cook our food. Bench guy talked to us like we were stupid.   I ordered two tacos one potato,  one veggie. Come to find out its the same just veggie has beans on top of the potato. My husband got a fish taco (which he said was the worst one,  even though it is their specialty), chicken and pork taco. He said the chicken and pork tasted the same. Maybe we missed what the hype is.  My guess is since the guacamole was out, it must have been the magic we were missing.

Fantastic little place.  I love going here, the owner and his staff are genuinely friendly and the atmosphere is always warm.  The little details of this place make it worth repeating.  Highly recommend!!!

I love that this place is right by UNLV. It makes food runs so worth it, especially on Tuesdays when they're only 1.25, with the exception of shrimp tacos. I always get potato, beef, & fish tacos. The potato taco is AMAZING! Wish I could describe it, but it's just something you have to try yourself. The owner/manager is always very friendly & welcoming which is a plus!

Not the best tacos or quesadillas I've had but I do like the variety of taco options. Also they have fried oreos, what the random cool, are we at a fair? They also have allllll sorts of hot sauces. Gets reallllllly busy on a Tuesday, line took 20 minutes, food took another 20 minutes, I think they had a group event going on next door that they were serving at 1 o'clock in the afternoon.

I did like the guacamole and potato taco though.

like this place a lot. i rotate Baja and Yayo's (across the street from each other)  both have good food and beer!  Baja is much mellower as yayos gets loud with music and live bands/poetry etc, so if your not in the mood for that ,but still want some great tacos and beer, goto Baja!

I recommend trying the chicken tacos but you must have their potato specialty, pretty unique. The regular fish taco wasn't a knock out, the shrimp might be the way to go, either wasn't expensive . Lots of different hot sauces to try. Lighthearted beach decor.  Owner cares about his food. Bargain overall.
Came in to town for the weekend and wanted to grab a bit off the strip. Yelp has never been so RIGHT! This place had excellent food and great prices.
Very good tacos! The spam taco was surprising good! We are from California so this was a pleasant surprise . Very down to earth place. Very nice people.

I went here for $1.25 taco Tuesday with a friend and I am so glad I did. I had 2 beef (steak) tacos with lettuce and cheese but they will make anyway you want. The meat was well seasoned and vary tasty. They have a big selection of hot sauces and the beer was cheap. Coors light for $2.50. Great place to go on a little budged. I will go again.
Best tacos I've had in Vegas (or most anywhere else for that matter). Fire roasted salsa is perfect!!

During a girls' weekend in Vegas, we got tired of the continuous gluttony of the buffets and the fake-ness of the strip and decided to try some 'local' place.  

We somehow found ourselves in the parking lot of the strip mall where this hole in the wall joint in located.  From the outside, it didn't look like much.  But when 2 cop cars pulled up next to us and entered this place for lunch, we were sold.  Hey, the whole point was to see where the locals were!

We had a great time talking with the staff and just hanging out in the place.

The potato tacos were fantastic!  Must try!

In our weekly quest to find a good place to eat, we stumbled upon Baja Grill, tried the Chicken, Pork, Beef and Potato tacos with beans and rice. Very impressed with the Potato and Beef tacos, the kind that you remember next day in your mouth.
Tried also the Nachos with beef which were very tasty and big.
Very nice and cozy place nearby UNLV, "Big Jefe" the owner is very friendly, we had a great time not only with the food, but with the great chat about Food and places.
Don't be put off that the owner is Asian, he surely knows how to build a great taco.
The house sauce has really good flavor, not too spicy, but, if you like your food spicy, they have a very nice collection of spicy sauces available ranging from the sweet and tasty to the suicide level where you may need to call 911.
Highly recommended place for lunch. Will be taking my co-workers on for Dollar taco tuesdays!

This place is amazing and so is their service. They have Taco Tuesday for only $1.25/taco. What a deal! I have tried all their tacos and they are all amazing. My favorite is the potato taco. The tacos are small street tacos which is perfect if you want to try all different types of meat.

I had their special 3 tacos and drink for 3.99 I tried the fish, steak, and potato tacos with their homemade salsa. I liked the potato taco not a fan of the fish. The customer service was amazing and I could not have meet better people.
This place was great sense being in the vegas area I haven't found good street tacos anywere I'm so happy and they are close to my home even better thank you guys and I will. E seeing you soon

Wasn't too impressed.
Pros: 
Free wifi
Close to UNLV
Has TV for entertainment while eating
Shrimp cocktail was good

Cons:
Ice machine was broken, but they still were serving drinks from the machine.
Also, there was no syrup in the soda machine, they should have placed a "not in service" sign and only sold bottled drinks instead of wasting people's money.
Air conditioning didn't seem to be working, it was very hot in there.
There was a junk mess where the seating area was.

Honestly, we probably won't return here, I think I'm being generous with the stars.
Good food, great atmosphere, friendly service. This place is so relaxed and the decor is entertaining. Love it!!

Best tacos around, hands down. Started coming here as soon as I started school at UNLV, and I come almost every week! Fish taco is as good as any I've ever had and Thursday 7-10 is $2 bottles, Tuesday is $1.25 tacos. You really can't beat this for a quality meal on a budget.
Pretty darn good!!!   We had the happy hour (street-style') chicken tacos and fried Oreos. Yum!!!

This place is great! Nothing better than a friendly owner who talks to their customers. The food was great! Many sauces to chose from and many taco options, I had the streak nachos and they were very tasty, very affordable and roomy. Give this place a try.

My favorite spot during the week! The location is perfect if you're a student @ UNLV like I am, the prices are all great for what you get, the fish tacos are so yum, and they have pretty good drink specials especially on game days. Taco everyday when it comes to Baja.
Awesome fish tacos! We also enjoyed the Nachos with chicken. The owner was very personable and helpful when ordering, we very much enjoyed our lunch.
i ordered their Beef Super Burrito, and it was decently yummy.  The guys who work there are super nice! I will definitely go back since it's so close to UNLV.

Food is legit and overall BOMB!! The potato tacos were whatever's to me but the shrimp tacos were sooooo delish!! Their shrimp tacos are NOT fried and more of a hawaiian style sautéed buttered shrimp. Shrimp tacos are topped with cabbage and nicely complimented with their special salsa. Oh so delish!!!

Also, what made our experience even better was the guy working there. Very friendly and courteous. He topped off our positive experience and we would definitely come back all because if him!!
Awesome people and yummy food. I always get the fish potato burrito! If I'm ever craving for Mexican food this is the place to come NO MATTER HOW FAR THE DRIVE! :]

My girlfriend and I have been going to Baja for happy hour for well over a year now and we'll continue to go--we've never left disappointed!

The carnitas, chicken, and fish tacos are all great, but we're completely hooked on the potato tacos. I know it sounds weird, but their seasoned hash brown style potatoes make for awesome tacos. 

They run daily specials often, we're so hooked on the cheap beer and dollar tacos that we rarely stray, but I've never seen anyone order anything that doesn't look delicious.

My friend found this place on Yelp and dragged me here after I picked her up from the airport. We got fish tacos and potato tacos. 

The fish tacos were awesome! At most places, the fish tacos consist of fried fish and you would judge them on how much they don't taste like fish sticks. Here, the fish tacos are made with GRILLED TILAPIA. It's a nice change and it tastes fantastic!

The potato tacos are also awesome! The shell reminds you of a soft bird nest that holds the flavorful potato together. 

We went on Friday and there was no one there (apparently UNLV doesn't have classes on Fridays?). The owners were very friendly and even threw in some fried oreos for us. They're pretty good. Not too different from the county fair staple, but who can hate county fair fried food :)

Definitely coming back here on my next Vegas trip!

My recommendations:
- Potato taco
- Fish taco

Casual and comfortable atmosphere. Excellent and friendly service... I tried the beef, chicken, fish, and potato tacos. They're not 1.00 during happy hour they're 1.25. The beef tacos were by far the best. The potato taco came in second. The chicken was bland and fish taco a little too fishy. I showed my yelp check in but instead of one full order of fried Oreos they gave us literally one Oreo. Overall happy with our experience.

Hands down, the greatest place to spend your Taco Tuesday...or really any day that ends in y.  

The place is casual and charming - very chill vibe and the selection of different tacos is extensive - they're always adding new menu items to try.  My personal faves are the chicken and potato tacos and the chicken or steak nachos, very fresh ingredients.  

The pricing is fair - you're able to eat 3/4 tacos + drink a beer under $10. 

Right by UNLV with plenty of parking and easily accessible.   Perfect place to pre-game a UNLV basketball game.

The owner, Art, is a friendly guy and always down for conversation. Recently threw a friends going away party there and it was a great time.  The new bar side is also great for a group of friends to sit around a catch up.

Another great hidden restaurant in the college corridor. You know you're in for some cheap eats when there's a place around the college. The food here is really good and seasoned just right. Everyone is friendly and treat you like family (good side of the family, not the cousin in prison side). I highly recommend coming here, shrimp burrito, super chicken burrito, carne asada taco, potatoe taco, fish taco, chicken nachos, and fish n chips washed down with deep fried Oreos. Everyone here all thumbs up from the crew. Highly recommend!!

Went here for lunch in between appointments. I had the classic club sandwich with chips and it was very tasty and very filling. 

Staff were friendly

Love this place! Their fish tacos are delicious. 

Plus they do a great happy hour later in the day (I think it goes from about 4-7) Shrimp and fish is always fresh and when you add avocado it's perfection. 

Their shrimp tacos are fantastic! I go here all the time and have never been disappointed.

I just wish they were open a little later!
Good, cheap tacos on tuesday but outdated specials on yelp and outside. Not so big on the snarky bumper stickers inside, but can't really complain about dollar tacos.

I took a friend here thinking maybe she would like it because of the high rating. I thought maybe I just had a average run there (giving it a 3 star rating). The food wasn't anything to return to and the owner didn't really want to honor the free Yelp check in. He said it was an older offer. My friend who is new to Yelp was excited to try it but wasn't blown away like the high star rating claims. I wasn't either. Fool me twice. . . .
This spot is literally my favorite taco place on the planet!!! I went here 1-2 times a week while in grad school  at UNLV and now whenever I visit I ALWAYS stop by here!! A must visit!!

Po-TAY-toe, po-TAH-toe... however you wanna slice it, throw it in a taco and it instantly goes from an 18th century Irish food staple to a modern day college student's Mexican eatery hit. Seriously, don't knock the potato tacos until you try them. They're unexpectedly good.

Baja Bar & Grill sits in the same plaza as Smash Burger, Firehouse Subs, Aloha Kitchen, et al. With its proximity to the university and its school-spirited decor, it goes without saying that they cater mostly to the fiscally-conscious college demographic. Specials galore -- Happy Hour 4-7p (M-F), Taco Tuesday $1.25 all tacos (except shrimp), and Rebel Thursdays ($2/$3 booze) to name a few. With a Yelp check-in, you even get a freebie. Your choice of a potato taco or fried oreos, which I have yet to try.

I stopped in recently and the guy at the counter reminded me of a Hawaiian New Yorker. I know that seems like a total contradiction, but he was laid-back yet terse and frazzled. It could have been due to the fact it was taco tuesday and he was manning both the cashier register and doubling as a bus boy. 

As for food, I wouldn't say they have THE best tacos -- El Gordo still has that spot for me -- but for the pricing, location, and efficiency, this place will satisfy your taco cravings.

This place is the best! I came here because class ended up  early on a Saturday and I didn't brought lunch from home. The place is very inviting !  Art is amazing ! He welcomed me as soon as I walked in and we started having a conversation about the place. 

I ordered a fish taco and a potato taco. Both of them where amazing !  
There is a bar and the place has a awesome vibe. Definitely a good place to check out and enjoy some tacos .

This is my favorite taco shop in Vegas! 

Everything is a home run...

1) Food...the tacos are GREAT! The potato and the pork are my personal favs! 

2) Prices...the owner strives to keep the prices as low as possible without jeopardizing the quality of the food! Myself and a friend ordered 8 tacos and 2 beers...our bill...$14!!! 

3) The Service...awesome! Super laid back and always helpful! 

If you're in the UNLV area you owe it to yourself to stop in...

PS...the new Spam taco (aloha taco) is BOMB! 

Oh and make sure to load up on the salsa! 

It's so damn tasty!

So good! Wow! MUST GO! Thanks fellow Yelpers!

#1, 3 tacos and a drink = $5.00!!!! Made to order! Worth the 5-10 mins it takes to recieve your order!! 

I ordered the chicken, fish and potato tacos. I am in L O V E with the potato taco!!!!! SOOOOOoooOOOO good!!! All three were fantastic, but, I had an instant love for the potato taco! I have already recommended this place to 5 people at work!

The owner and the cooks are super cool and very friendly! 

I will be going back OFTEN!

Well i ordered the fish tacos like others recommended...what are they thinking? It's just OK but tasty very fishy to me. Sign of not the best quality but I guess what could i expect for the price. It's so cheap here.

I'm from NJ, came here since I can't eat fast food and my whole crew decided to go to In N Out. Went on a Tuesday during Happy hour...had $1 tacos. They were kinda tiny but they were definitely delicious. Sam Adams for $2.50 wasn't bad either. Great employees. Very friendly and sociable.

By far one of my favorite taco places! They have this potato taco that is amazing, definitely a must try. The staff is always friendly and willing to make you the perfect taco. Great atmosphere plus awesome happy hour specials! Prices are very reasonable!
Chicken tacos, beef burrito, corn on the cob was so good and fried Oreos and fried Twinkie was delish!!

Right, so I had the fish tacos there, and I seriously had to search for the fish. I mean I am sure there were some itty bitty teeny tiny pieces of fish, more like they waved a fish over those tacos.. Humph.. bummer, I wanted to like this place, but that was a major disappointment.. Pass...

Came here for the firs time and I had to come back the same day for more. 
The fish tacos are my favorite, but there's a great menu with various options to choose from.
Art the owner is great and his staff is very friendly.
Check in on Yelp and get to try fried Oreos or the potato taco for free in your first visit! 
Stop by have some tacos and pass the word.

Riding around in Vegas, looking for a cheap lunch....decided to stop in. Pleasantly surprised. Excellent burritos, clean. If you want to get away from the strip for a few minutes or you get a hankering for a burrito, you could do worse.

Wow, what a great Mexican place! The most amazing collection of sauces I've ever seen. Their homemade sauce was enough though, the food is very tasty, and the price is certainly right. Fish tacos FTW!

I come here for their Taco Tuesday's when their tacos are $1.50 except for their shrimp which is a little more expensive. I've tried their beef, pork and fish tacos and they're very tasty! I definitely recommend them! Also, if you check in you get the choice of a free potato taco or a deep fried Oreo. I tried the deep fried Oreo and it comes with chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar. Those are good as well and I would definitely order them again!
Been coming here since I was enrolled in UNLV.  Fantastic food, people, and atmosphere!  Like it so much had to bring my wife and her friends from Taiwan here! We all love it! Thanks for being here!!
The potatos and veggie tacos were the best! Love all the sauces. The guys are so friendly and fun to talk to.

Today was my first time here and I love it.  Really good tostadas and tacos. Awesome decor. Cheap prices. Can't beat it. Really close to unlv. Owner is really nice. Be careful when trying the hot sauce challenge.

Wow! This place is a hidden treasure. Seen it here for while and decided to stop in for their happy hour. Beers $1 off and all soft tacos (except for shrimp) are $1.25.  I ended up having the fish, potato and pork tacos. Loved the potato, pork was damn good as well but fish was ok. Not bad by any means but just ok. The restaurant side was wicked hot, I know it's hot outside too but maybe the air conditioning was out that day!?! No worries, the bar side was dark and cool.  Enjoyed a few beers with my tacos. Overall nice experience and some great food. Will be back for sure.

You have to try their shrimp tacos! TRUST ME. They are damn good. After my 5th visit in 2 weeks, I feel like I've now become a regular. They are just sooo good! They even are good as leftovers. I once took some tacos home, put them in the refrigerator, and ate them 5 hours later. Yup, still delicious!

The staff are also very friendly and the atmosphere is chill. Perfect for any college student with a taco craving.

Taco Tuesday: A day where you can get any of their tacos for only $1.25

Baja Bar & Grill is a great taco joint for many reasons. They offer deals like $1.25 a taco on tuesdays but also have happy hours special from 4-7pm everyday. Not to mention, their tacos are pretty darn good. Cheap and bomb tacos? What college kids doesn't like that?

Had variety of tacos to choose from. I got their chicken, beef and baja. I have to say beef and baja were good but chicken was mediocre. It felt dry, almost felt like I was eating turkey meat. Tacos were small but great deal regardless. They did not skimp out on meat and I enjoyed my tacos very much.

Service is fast and friendly. My favorite taco joint right by UNLV! Make sure to check-in on yelp for a choice of free fried oreos or potato tacos.

If you love tacos (who doesn't) than come to this place. It's amazing tasting tacos and the price is nice to take in too. Located right by UNLV, and it's a small chill restaurant. One taco is $1.75, on Tuesdays they have a $1.25 taco special. The ingredients in the taco aren't too overbearing over Eachother because the way they make it is just right. The owners are always there, so you really feel at home eating there. I think this place isn't well known, which is why it's empty everytime I go, but it makes it fast to get your food which is good so no waiting hahah. Def recommend this place!

Street style tacos are over the top. I had the three taco combo plate with one fish, one beef, and one chicken. All were good. Next time I would get all fish. No complaints from the other two with me. One less star because the bar was closed. That was a very bad thing after flying in and driving for 45 minutes thru heavy traffic, accidents, construction, and multiple road and lane closures. Good bottled beer selection for a strip mall joint.

How does this place have a 4.5 star rating.  I'm either crazy or the people leaving ratings don't eat out much. A buddy brought me here on a 2-4-1 coupon in the entertainment guide.    I had a cranky staff person and come to find out it's the owner ART.  He rolled his eyes at us when we were ordering sorry is ny first time and I had questions.   I won't be back.  Was not good

Taco Tuesday, oh how I love thee. 

On Tuesdays, you get an assortment of tacos for cheap. $1.25 cheap. These aren't Old El Paso hard shells and hamburger helper tacos. These are some hand made tacos and there are plenty to choose from. The tacos may appear tiny but they pack a punch. 

I went with Beef / Chicken / and Spam. Why spam? WHY NOT. Spam is great. It's the right mixture of salt and meat. The taco had the spam cut up into strips which was a good decision. They load up the tacos (they ask you first if you want the works). The beef was also very good. The chicken was a little dry but a bunch of salsa did the trick.

Just a note: It's an older building that's been through some tenants. When we were there, the owner had fixed some of the AC but it was warm in the dining area. You had to sit underneath the unit for some coolness. The bar wasn't open at lunch time but that will soon change the owner assured us. I have been to the bar side of the restaurant before and that is generally much cooler (both in temperature and ambiance).

It's between a 3-3.5for me. 

I checked in and got a free potato taco, shrimp taco, fish taco, beef(carne asada) taco, and a side of rice. Don't judge, I was very hungry haha.

The potato one was surprisingly good! The cheese complimented it very well.
The shrimp taco and fish taco were my favorites. Thad a good size shrimp with them! And the fish had a nice flavor too them!
And I've had better beef tacos, but it was still good.
I absolutely love spanish rice. HOWEVER, this rice wasn't steamed all the way as it was a little hard.. and I didn't like something about how they prepared it..

I also ordered a side of rice, side of beans, and 2 chicken tacos without the tortilla for my friend, and even tho the guy repeated the order back to me, he still gave us the wrong order (gave us the tortilla, no tomato). She just ate it without the tortilla still, but what's the point of ordering it a specific way and clarifying you can do it, but then get it wrong?

All in all, I'll probably be back. I mean, I do love my tacos but only if I'm around campus, because I've had bomb tacos else where!

Fish and shrimp tacos are my personal favorites. Be sure to check in and receive a free potato taco, another highlight! Love having a cheap, close, and healthy option right next to UNLV. Owner is super friendly and always very school spirited!

Easy Go-To for Taco Tuesdays, located by UNLV it's a literal hop, skip and a jump from nearby areas. The service is always friendly and fast and you cannot beat the prices. I get there as often as I can for, at least, taco Tuesdays ...but sometimes you're in the mood for a spam taco.. and they have it! 

Get down here and give it a try. 

Happy eating!

Its been far too long since last I came to Baja Bar and Grill. I used to come here all the time when I was a student. Makes me wonder why I never posted a review. Or did I and it just disappeared? I don't know but here is a review for the modern era.

Baja Bar and Grill has been open for about 9 years, per the owners. In that time I have seen them grow from the tiny dive they started out as to the slightly bigger dive they are today. When you come in you are sure to see a lot of funny bumper stickers and a variety of hot sauces. It all makes for some entertaining reading as you wait for your food. They also have games you can play while you are in there socializing, drinking, eating, etc. At least they used to.

I typically get the same things when I go in. I've tried a few different menu items but I know what I lile and what I go back to time after time. Like tonight when I ordered a chicken burrito amd a potato taco (free with Yelp check-in). I love both. They are my two favorite items on the menu. And they are consistently on point. Even after all these years. Full flavor and filling. Loaded with the goods (lettuce, salsa, onions, etc.). I'm not even hungry right now and I am salivating just writing about it.

Who knew a couple of Hawaiian guys could put together a kick-ass Mexican dive bar like this. These braddahs know what they're doing and I am a fan. And if their food isn't reason enough to come in (or back), they remembered me even though it had been at least 4 years since last I visited. How's that for service? And they asked me when I left not to wait so long next time. I'd love to come by more often but I'm just not in the area much these das. But as long as they stay open I'll come back. No matter how long that takes.

This place is great. Food is generally inexpensive and their food does not drip with grease like many other Mexican taco shops do. 

 I ordered the fish burrito ($4). The way they do their fish is a little different that I'm accustomed to. They seem to just grill their fish (tilapia), instead of using the deep fried battered fish that I usually see. Also, it seems like no sour cream, tar tar sauce or guacamole has been added. I'm not sure if you can order the stuff optionally. Definitely a much healthier tasting burrito than the nearby Roberto's though, which I'm happy about. 

I'm definitely coming back to try their other stuff.

Have been here twice now.  Stopped in first for lunch and got their 3 tacos lunch special.  The tacos were great.  The owner is super friendly and enthusiastic.   A few days later I stopped by for their happy hour special -- $1 tacos and $2 beers.  Tacos were great again and the staff was friendly.

I will definitely be back to this place.  You should stop by, too!
The fish tacos are bomb and they have good pricing. I will definetly be back. They also have great  customer service!

I decided to visit Baja in national taco day. By the time we arrived they were out of most ingredients and overwhelmed. The shrimp taco was the best of what I was able to try, I am going to have to come back another day to get a fair assessment of this place.

I love this place! Always good customer service, great specials and chill atmosphere. Fridays they have their fish taco special for $1.25 each. I haven't tried any of their drinks or come in while they're having their drink speicals, but it looks like a great place to have a drink. Great vegetarian options as well!

Great fish tacos, they don't batter the fish they grill it. The Baja burger is an excellent value and delicious as well. Located close to UNLV, it's a small cozy dive. The staff are very friendly and will sit and talk with you. Highly recommend if you're looking for good inexpensive food off the strip.
Best Mexican food near UNLV and in Las Vegas. The prices are great! 3 tacos and a drink for $5. Can't beat that! And the workers are really cool and funny.

You'll walk in to a busy, tiki-decorated taco shop. The highlight is their TACO TUESDAYS, which offers $1.25 tacos except for shrimp. Awesome price for delicious and colorful tacos right near the edge of UNLV. I mostly get the potato tacos. Fish tacos are not breaded, and seem to be the most popular item. Chicken tacos are just a bit bland. Lots of different and funky hot sauces to choose from. Definitely a place to stop by, but make sure you have some time on your hands as they do take a bit to make your food.

Not the best. I tried this place due to the many awesome reviews and location next to UNLV. I was greeted by someone kinda rudely who made many excuses for the wait. I thought the sign about the wait times was super unprofessional...I was the only one in the place and waited over 15 minutes for a crappy burrito. I probably should have ordered the tacos, but the burrito was awful and the guy at the counter was not someone who really wanted my business. Will not be returning.

After a day of meetings and a pretty unappealing boxed lunch, I decided to stop by Baja Bar & Grill for a late lunch/early dinner.

Fortunately for me, it was happy hour.  Three tacos and a beer cost me just under $5.00.  I thought to myself, wow, am I really in Vegas?  

I had a shrimp, a fish and a chicken taco.  All three were nicely done.  I really enjoyed the chicken.  It had a nice crispy consistency.  Very good.

The staff was helpful and friendly and seemed genuinely happy that I was dining with them. 

Stop by, it is worth a visit!

Baja offers so-so tacos, but the establishment is plagued by lack of cleanliness. Ambiance has this hole-in-the-wall feel. Decked out in wood paneling, aluminum ceiling, and brown (faux?) leather seating, they really strive for this beach and laid back atmosphere. But I was little grossed out (as Misti remarked) about the stained trashcan right next to the tables and bar stools. The fountain station was leaking and the cup covers were not replenished. The area was also littered with boxes and dirty straw covers. That aside, the owner was really nice and explained the menu and recommended the fish, and notified me the 3 tacos + drink= $4.99 deal. So I ordered the chicken, pork, and fish taco.

Tacos are served on foam plates and they're a bit small and kinda skimpy on the meat portions. My favorite was the chicken taco. It had the best flavor and it wasn't oily. Pork (I don't know why they don't just call it carnitas) was fine, nothing special. The fish is grilled which I loved. But it was actually disappointing. Instead of a nice and firm filet, the fish was masticated to bits. The flavor tasted liked old bay seasoning and where was my citrus lime? Even though they had a massive selection of hot sauces, I grabbed one that was already expired. Ugh. I prefer a smaller selection of freshly made salsas and hot sauces over this massive collection. Quality over quantity, man.  

With a little scrub down and a better fish taco, Baja could be a college staple. In the meantime, I'll stick to Yayo.

Based upon a friends recommendation, I decided to give this place a try. 

I ordered the fish tacos which was grilled rather than fried hence is being not greasy at all! It was very delicious and I like how the restaurant managed to create an awesome impression of them. 

The tacos along with the beer I ordered was inexpensive. Their hot sauce was the best and I would visit this place again just to get my hands on it!

I came here with a few friends before a meeting at UNLV. Initially walking into the place I was sketched out. It's certainly a divey, hole in the wall with nothing fancy about it. It's also a little bit weird that you order food on one side and the bar is completely on the other. 

Food wise this place was just ok to me. I had the Chips & Salsa to start. The portion size was decent, but the chips were super bland and oily. For a meal I had one of the fish tacos & one of the shrimp tacos. Both were just alright, nothing special. I used a lot of the salsa to give them more flavor.

To top it off the service was also sub par. My order took the longest between my two other friends and I ordered first. I honestly think they forgot about my order since as soon as I asked about it, it came out within minutes. I can't say I'd be back again.

We stopped here after dropping my daughter at volleyball camp at UNLV. My husband had the chicken burrito and it was very good and I had three tacos. Pork,  chicken and jalapeno shrimp,  all were delicious! The owner was super friendly.

This place is sooooo good! I ordered Carne Asada and pork tacos and they are fire! Next door they have a tequila bar with a great selection of tequila. The food was great and the service was great. Everyone is very nice there. Definitely coming back!
Amazing tacos (fish and potato) for 1.25$ on Tuesday! Super friendly staff, very clean place, definitely recommend 100%

Great spot and great staff 
I had a 3 taco plate with beans and rice 2 chicken tacos and 1 fish taco.
My daughter also had the 3 taco plate with beans and rice she had hers with shrimp tacos...everything was delicious..While we were eating i checked us in on yelp and they gace ilus 2 fried oreos which my daughter ate both and loved..
Ohhh yeah i almost forgot...they were having a taco eating contest when we were there too..its like a $12 buy in and lasts 10 minutes..so we had a lil entertainment while we ate.
They also run happy hr from 4-7 pm Monday-Friday with $1.25 tacos..cant beat that at all..
I'll definitely be back..

Such amazing tacos and a good vibe around. My boyfriend and I came in here during happy hour, and we ordered 8 tacos (4 fish) (2 chicken) and (2 steak). All of them were amazing but the first tacos were the BEST fish tacos I've had in Las Vegas, I was so surprised. So juicy and tender. Plus their fish tacos are grilled and not fried. They were so good. The other tacos  were good as well, but the fish tacos definitely takes the cake! Our bill was only $20 and we ordered 8 tacos and 2 beers, which isn't pricy AT ALL!  Plus they have $2 tequila shots
On Thursday's  ! I will definitely be a regular here from now on. I'm glad yelp put this place on my recommendations, because I probably wouldn't have known about it if they didn't. This place is definitely a 5 star, plus the staff was amazing and very attentive.
Outstanding little restaurant. Service was prompt and the food was delicious! If your in the area, you should definitely try it out.

Probably my favorite favorite favorite taco place near UNLV! 

I ALWAYS order the same thing lol. I never get tired of it. I get the potato taco, fish taco, fries, and an order of guacamole. Their potato taco is heavenly. It's so unique and different. I honestly didn't think I was going to like it but I love it! I would put it under the have to try category. Their fish taco is alright. Their fries are good. Their guacamole... Is the best. It's my favorite guacamole in Vegas, if that means anything to anyone lol. I love guacamole & I think they have the best here. The fried Oreos are greaaaattt too!

Baja easily earned their five star review from me! I came in Monday night and was the only customer (as UNLV students are currently on holiday break). The manager immediately sprung into action, accommodated my Yelp check-in for a free potato taco, and recommended the fish and beef tacos as well. (From 4-7 PM tacos are only $1.25, bringing my grand total to $2.50 plus tax. Score!) 

I only had to wait about 5-6 minutes (and their TV was turned to Monday Night Football game, bonus!). 

My tacos were absolutely loaded with lettuce, cilantro, tomatoes, and other goodies! My favorite was definitely the delightfully crispy potato taco, but I enjoyed the beef and fish tacos as well. 

I'll be back...soon!
The Mexican food here was little different than San Francisco, but amazing. I am vegetarian, and all the veggie stuff here are awesome.

Randomly came here for lunch and it was SICK.  Not only was the price $, but the beer was a $.  Happy hour here put a smile on my face.  

I would careless if there was a golden taco on the strip.   Give this place some love and you'll never believe it.  One of the best fish tacos. 

I left full and buzz for 20 bucks!

Just in from LA... Loving this place. Brian's a cool cat. 

FOOD: Tacos are amazing.  Had the following tacos: Fish, Potato, Veggie, Popper.  

STAFF: Uber friendly and helpful.  Definitely coming back. 

COST: Oh yeah... we caught happy hour and two of us ate for under $18 with a soda and beer.

Stopped in before dropping the parents off at the airport.
Greeted by the owner as we walked in, he was super friendly, and talked us through the menu.
We decided on a variety of tacos, all were amazing.
Prices were great as well.

I am a frequent customer at Baja Bar & Grill because it is a perfect place to stop for a bite to eat when leaving UNLV.  It is located on the west side of Maryland, so it's easy to get to if you park on UNLV's campus.  It's even a good place to go instead of the library because they have free wi-fi!

The ambience is exactly what you want from a Baja style grill.  There is a selection of about 50 different types of salsas and hot sauces, and there are smart-ass stickers and signs on the wall that say stuff like, "Pleas be patient, I only have two speeds, and I don't think you will like the other", and "Wife and dog missing: reward for dog".  There are about 5 tables and a small little bar to sit at, so it's pretty small.  

The food is solid and consistent.  I've never been blown away by anything on the menu, and I've never been disappointed by anything, either.  I usually get the fish tacos, which are grilled rather than fried, and the carne asada tacos.  The tacos are all served on small corn tortillas with cabbage, tomato, onion, cilantro, and cotija cheese.  The fish usually gets overpowered by the other flavors, but the overall flavor of the tacos are good, and the fish is Tilapia so it doesn't have much flavor to begin with.  I like to use a mix of their house green salsa and a little habanero salsa on the tacos, but you have a variety to choose from with all of their hot sauces.  
The Burritos are also pretty good, my favorite being the fish burrito.  They are a pretty good size and are only around 5 bucks.  
The key at a place like this is to enjoy your food with a Mexican beer.  They have a selection of mexican beers that really change the entire meal.  Fish tacos are great and all, but fish tacos with a cerveza is what life is all about!

The service is friendly, courteous, and perfect for a baja style grill.  The guys behind the counter are always very entertaining, as they love talking to the customers about whatever is going on.  You know the place is gonna be good when you notice a lot of regulars walk in talking to the customers.

If you go on a Monday you can get really cheep beer, if you go on Tuesday you get all tacos for a buck, and if you come on fridays you will get a combination of cheep beer and tacos for a buck.
Solid 5 stars!  Tried some soft shell tacos and a few hard shell chicken.  All around great.  Everyone was friendly and a cool atmosphere.
They are closed on Sundays. Yelp said open so caught an Uber there before our flight. Alas they were closed.

Excellent tacos! I had the fish, chicken and beef. Beef was my favorite. Seasoned very well. Everything seemed freshly prepared. Would definitely go back again! Their menu is posted on the wall using pictures. The food actually comes out that way too (unlike most).

This place has the best fish tacos for cheap prices ! I always get the 3 tacos and a drink for I think it's $6.25 and the bar next door has good deals too. Especially for happy hour. They have the best customer service.

Not a bad taco place. We tried the potato, chicken, beef, pork and fish tacos. The chicken and potato taco were the best out of the selection. What was really good was their salsa. The inside of the restaurant is small and cute- a good college hangout place. The restaurant is in a sketchy neighborhood though... Good thing they don't stay open late.

Awesome tacos!!!
We're actually heading back home to L.A. and wanted some Mexican food and found tho place here on Yelp. It happened to be taco Tuesday too, so tacos were only 1.25! They were very, very good! And their house made salsa is amazing! Not super hot, but the flavor is incredible!

Check this place out!!!

If I were a college kid, this place would probably be one of my regular go-tos. It definitely feels like a college town institution-- small, a little rough around the edges and with some cheap beer during happy hours and dirt cheap beer on Monday nights, plus a super friendly Asian owner and staff. The super friendly staff combined with free Twizzlers make it hard not to like the place at least a little. Free WiFi is available too.

Their proclaimed specialty is the fish taco made with a tilapia filet cooked up on a griddle. I saw the cook squirt some squeeze butter on the fish. I wasn't sure if that was odd, but I personally didn't find it too appealing when I witnessed it. In addition to fish tacos, they have steak, chicken, pork and potato. I ordered two fish and one potato.

When the tacos arrived my first impression was, "Wow, these are small, but attractive." They are made on approximately 4-inch corn tortillas, which are doubled up, and then topped with lots of fresh greens (either lettuce or cabbage), cilantro, onions and tomatoes. They are served with some salsa. The salsa is relatively bland, but there is a vast selection of hot sauces to spice things up. As for the flavor of the tacos, the fish tacos were good. The potato taco was delicious. A definite special treat for the vegetarians out there.  

I don't think these are the best tacos in Vegas if only for the simple fact that the tortillas are not made fresh in house. Plus, things could have been a little cleaner. For example, the lid of the trash can was covered with gunk and dried remains of other people's combo plates. Icky.

If I were to revisit, I'd probably come for happy hour, pretty sure it is 4-7pm. Even as an adult, I can appreciate a good happy hour!
Amazing taste and amazing value. Get the potato ones!  Great friendly staff as well, well worth the trip off the strip.
This place is a gem in terms of value compared to the overpriced places on the strip. Can't go wrong with tacos and affordable beer

Omg I found my new taco spot love it and on taco Tuesday tacos are 1.25 yum we got the fish taco papa taco Baka taco the jalapeño stuffed shrimp taco and the popper tacos and cuz tacos omg everything was amazing

$4.99 -3 mix and match tacos!

I VERY much enjoyed how these tacos! I tried the Shrimp, Fish, and Potatoe tacos- ALL DELICIOUS but specifically the fish and potatoe tacos. 

The fish taco is made with grilled talapia (not fried or battered like most baja fish tacos). The tacos come with a HUGE load of the basic mix of pico de gallo, cabbage/lettuce, onion, and QUESO fresco which I absolutely LOVE! I mean really, they are loaded. They use the small local brought YELLOW corn tortillas- which held very well!! (The cook would not tell me the brand for some reason :( )

Did I mention a fantasitc array of HOT SAUCES available at the counter to add to the already delicious tacos?? I recommmend using BLUE WARES hot sauce with the shrimp tacos- it's a great taste! 

The cook threw in their own house sauce which had a blended baja flavor- not bad at all! Note: the house sauce is SPICY FOR THE WIMPS and JUST RIGHT FOR THE PROS!! :D

On top of that, the owner and cook were very polite and more than happy to help me out with the menu on my first visit here. This joint is located right next to UNLV, it's small, and not at all fancy. The have a bar, cheap beer, and happy hour (Mon & Tues starting at 2pm) during the week also!

Really great bar and quick bite to eat spot. The staff are super nice and friendly, always makes you feel welcome. Very good prices on the food and beers as well, and it's conveniently located right next to UNLV.  It's also a great place to do some homework and have a drink!
Delicious tacos ($1.25 on taco Tuesday), they have so many taco options.  Great homemade salsa.  Lots of hot sauce choices.  And really friendly service.

Baja Bar & Grill has become my new favorite University restaurant. Located in the Smash Burger parking lot, Baja is just down the street from UNLV. The prices are definitely agreeable, particularly for the specials. A number 1 for example, includes 3 tacos of your choice with a drink for $5.50. The manager informed that Baja's specialty are fish tacos, but alas, I will never enjoy them because I'm a hardcore vegetarian.

I settled instead for 3 potato tacos, which were quite delectable by the way. I was pleased with the presentation but even more so by the taste. Baja's potato tacos are probably the most unique and creative tacos I've ever had. Everything from the corn tortilla to the last bit of cilantro was perfection. I even got to sample a fried oreo for dessert with the Yelp check-in. And of course it was delicious. 

The atmosphere at Baja screams University friendly. The manager is decked out in red clothes and Rebel gear and the restaurant is plastered with bottle caps spelling out UNLV in large letters. He's a friendly dude. 

I have to acknowledge some of the other Yelpers complaints - yes, the place needs a facelift and for some that's unacceptable. But if you like hole in the wall restaurants and are looking for some good food, you won't mind.

I came here tonight with my boyfriend because we were craving some authentic tacos, first off the owner is a super guy and the chef there was really fabulous too.  Not only was the food great but the conversation was even better.  When I was there, he had the opportunity to show how he is as a person and it sounds odd but I was super impressed.  So, I'm not only raving about his food but I am about him as a person.  If you're looking for good, cheap, and yummy tacos plus good conversation... this is the place.  I recommend the potatoe tacos but my boyfriend recommends all the kinds plus some to take home...

I'd heard good things about the potato tacos so I made it over one night.  He also had potato taquitos and when I couldn't decide he offered me a free potato taco so I could try both.  And then they made me two free potato tacos.  The potatoes had a great flavor- they were crispy, not greasy at all.   Excellent fresh salsa and guacamole.  Kind of a hole in wall place, but overall a great place to hang out near campus.  Good prices and free wi-fi.

They don't clean the grill here.  However, that's a good thing.  The flavors created by the crusty sear on that filthy grill are delicious.

I ordered the three taco combo meal, without the beans and rice.  I think it's the #4 if you're ordering the McDonald's way.  The good thing about this deal is that you get to mix and match your tacos.  So I got the shrimp, carne asada, and their famous tilapia.  Served with a soda for $5.99 and it's a great deal for a lighter lunch.  Very delicious tacos loaded with shredded cabbage and sharp Mexican cheese, accompanied some fresh radish, cucumber, and homemade salsa.

The hot sauce bar is pretty cool.  They serve about 50 different bottled hot sauces; I tried about 5 different ones that I thought were crazier looking.  I was hoping the flavor of the crazy looking hot sauce bottles would match their packaging, however each one disappointed.  The homemade salsa served with the tacos is fantastic.  Skip the bottled gimmicky stuff and stick with the sauce they put on the plate for you, just ask for an extra side. 

The grill at the Baja Bar and Grill wasn't the only thing that hasn't been cleaned in a while; the entire restaurant seemed just as dirty.  From the sticky, self-serve soda station covered with trash, to the overly stocked hot sauce buffet where each bottle was filthy and crusty by the 67 other people that used the bottle before you.  This place is kind of a dirty dive.  Did I mention the help yourself, complimentary licorice they offer to everyone?  Just think how many grubby hands dig their way into the tub o' twizzlers, right after they lick their fingers clean from the delicious tacos offered here.  I'm not a germaphobe, but there are a few things I would definitely stay away from at this restaurant. 

I'll come back to this place.  The tacos are amazing.  This place lost a star, maybe even two for cleanliness.  But like the saying goes, what doesn't kill you only makes you stronger.
Always coming here after studios and Jeff is always on point with his drinks!!! Haven't really eaten anything from here but I'm sure there food is good too

Visited Baja Bar & Grill last night with my fiance after we both got out of class. I was really, really impressed! For two meals, a drink, and a side of chips and guacamole it was only about $20. Plus, there was a taco eating contest so I guess we paid for entertainment, too! Our server (the owner) checked up on us frequently and asked if we needed anything else. I got the fish and chips, and they were amazing! We also got a side of chips and guac - they do not skimp you on the guac! Overall it was delicious and I will definitely be returning.
Great food. Shrimp tacos were amazing. Chicken tacos were very good to. Owner was a very polite and a nice guy.

Oh. Em. Double Dogg Gee.

EAT here now!

Fresh, fast, healthy, affordable & delicious!

Phenomenal daily specials!  

I highly recommend the Chicken Tostada, Carne Asada Tacos, and the Bacon Wrapped Jalapeño Taco if you like spicy!

Loved the decor and hilarious signs and bumper stickers!

The owner was super friendly and very inviting.

There is a small bar separated from the eating area.

Also, the washroom was immaculate on my visit!  Bonus star = 6 if I could give it!

PS there is a Yelp check-in offer :-)
Good food, great prices. Worth the drive away from the strip. Cool guy runs the place.

Stopped in for some chips and salsa and to kill some time, best decision we made! Chips were warm and freshly made- salsa was also from scratch the way it should be and so tasty with the perfect amount of spice.

The owner was in and able to recommend the fish tacos, amazing! We had a nice mix of fish, beef and potato all of which were off the hook! 

To make everything even better it was happy hour and we didn't even know it! Ended up feeding 4 of us for $14! Honestly one of the best values I've ever received for quality made to order food! 

Highly recommended if you are in the area! 

(It's probably relevant to mention that we are from Arizona where good Mexican food is easy to find, this is some of the best we've had!) 

Enjoy

I love it here. End of story. 

I was hooked on their chicken quesadilla's when they first opened about a year ago. I probably ate there once or twice a week. 
I've always been a fan of local eats but with the surrounding corporate mexican options in the neighborhood, it can get easily overlooked. 

Now that I'm older and wiser I've explored the rest of their menu, I can still say this is my favorite mexican joint in the area. There potato tacos are unique and to absolutely tasty. They say they're known for their fish taco, but in my opinion, their potato taco has NOTHING on their fish taco. 
They have taco Tuesdays which makes the tacos affordable for the typical college student, AND they have happy hour on their beer. 

Now really, let's think this through here, a local mexican place for dollar tacos and happy hour on beer?! HOW IS A COLLEGE STUDENT TO TURN THIS DEAL DOWN?! Exactly. 

The owner's a laugh and super laid back. I love all the fun signs they use for decoration, it adds to the local feel with tons of character. 

Next time you're at UNLV between classes, you have to check this place out.

I'm not one to stick to things I know when it comes to food. I like to branch out - try new foods and restaurants. That being said, it was time to explore a new Mexican joint around UNLV, seeing as I've been to all of them around campus. 

I'd passed by many times and was curious about trying it out. While standing a mere 15 feet from the door, I did a quick check on Yelp and it was done, I was definitely going to check it out today (6/9/11.)

Walking inside, you're met by a cute beachy interior. It's laid back, but doesn't feel dirty. I didn't know what to order, and just went with the suggested 3 tacos for $4.99.  I had the chicken, shrimp and fish topped with cabbage and pico de gallo. There's something so fun about eating little corn tortilla tacos, and the ones at Baja are no exception. 

The fish, well, I hate fish, but these, these were really good! (Yeah, I'll order things I think I hate, just to see if I'll like it if it is prepared in a different way.) The shrimp were good (and there is no upcharge!) and the chicken, well, that was the best one. For some reason, the seasoning on the chicken, mixed with the cabbage on top reminded me of the flavors of moo shu and hoisin sauce. 

The owner and chef were very friendly and we chatted while I ate and went over my anatomy & physiology book. It's not often that you find staff that are both cool and interesting to talk with - where it's not forced (I've felt trapped at some restaurants when I've gotten stuck talking with owners.) They're chill and were nice enough to make and serve me a deep fried Oreo, on the house! I'd never had a deep fried Oreo, and I'm one of the few people on earth that can pass on Oreos, but this was good! It tasted like warm cake and I'd suggest giving it a try if you've never eaten one. 

It really surprises me that there weren'ta ton of people eating in here (I came after it had been open 20 minutes so maybe that's why) - the food here is much better than anything on campus (and better than much that's around campus as well!) The next time I'm hankering for some Mexican food, I'm gonna hit up Baja again!

Happy Hour 4-7?! $1.00 tacos?! Great service?! Nice portion size?!

This place is great! We have been three times now, and have not been disappointed on any visit! 

Despite arriving 5 minutes to 7 our first visit, the staff said not to rush,they would honor the happy hour special priced tacos when we were ready.
